name: Marinated Salmon on Toothpicks
description: Use the freshest salmon you can find, preferably wild salmon, for these glistening little bites.
recipeYield: Serves 10 to 12 as an hors d’oeuvre
recipeIngredient: 3/4 pound salmon fillet, skin and small bones removed
2 teaspoons grated or finely chopped fresh ginger

recipeInstructions.text: Remove all of the pin bones from the salmon, and cut into 1/2-inch cubes. Place in a bowl, and season with salt and pepper. Toss with the soy sauce, rice vinegar, mirin, sesame oil and ginger. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes.

Cut the avocado into 1/2-inch cubes, and place in a bowl. Pour some of the marinade from the salmon into the bowl, and toss gently. Thread two pieces of salmon and one avocado cube onto each toothpick. Arrange on a platter and serve.
